episodeTitle: Operation Utopia Commences! The Swell of Rebellion Stirs!
description: Crocodile reveals the full extent of Operation Utopia to the imprisoned Vivi. Meanwhile, Mr. 2 Bon Clay impersonates King Cobra and publicly confesses to using Dance Powder, while announcing plans to destroy Nanohana. Koza is shot when confronting the fake king, and Mr. 1 and Miss Doublefinger crash an armory ship into the city, providing weapons for the rebel army. The rebellion begins its march toward Alubarna.

events.title: Crocodile Explains Operation Utopia
events.description: Crocodile reveals the full details of Operation Utopia to Vivi, explaining his elaborate plan to overthrow the Arabasta Kingdom, dispose of King Cobra, and acquire the ancient weapon Pluton. He describes how he's orchestrated the drought, civil unrest, and rebellion over several years.
events.significance: This is the first full explanation of the main antagonist's master plan and reveals Crocodile's ultimate goal: obtaining one of the three Ancient Weapons. It also establishes the scale of the conspiracy and how Baroque Works has manipulated an entire kingdom.

quotes.text: This is Operation Utopia - the plan to take over Arabasta and acquire Pluton.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile reveals his true ambitions to the imprisoned Vivi and the Straw Hats

events.title: Debut of Ending Theme 'GLORY -Kimi ga Iru Kara-'
events.description: This episode marks the debut of the seventh ending theme for One Piece, 'GLORY -Kimi ga Iru Kara-' performed by Takako Uehara. The ending animation features scenes of Vivi in the desert and her journey with the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: First use of this ending theme which will run through the remainder of the Arabasta Arc climax.

events.title: King Cobra is Kidnapped
events.description: King Nefertari Cobra is kidnapped by Baroque Works agents as part of Operation Utopia. This allows Mr. 2 Bon Clay to impersonate the king using his Clone-Clone Fruit ability.
events.significance: The kidnapping of Arabasta's legitimate ruler is a crucial step in Crocodile's plan, enabling the impersonation scheme that will escalate the civil war.

events.title: Mr. 2 Impersonates King Cobra
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Clay uses his Mane Mane no Mi (Clone-Clone Fruit) abilities to perfectly impersonate King Cobra. The fake king appears in Nanohana and makes a public announcement, confessing to using Dance Powder to steal rain from the rest of the kingdom for the capital's benefit.
events.significance: This impersonation is the key catalyst that pushes the rebellion past the point of no return. By having the 'king' publicly confess to the Dance Powder conspiracy and announce plans to destroy Nanohana, it removes any remaining doubt among the rebels and justifies their march on Alubarna.

quotes.text: I confess - I have been using Dance Powder to steal the rain from you all! And now I must eliminate Nanohana to prevent this truth from reaching the Marines!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 2 Bon Clay (as King Cobra)
quotes.context: The fake king's public confession that enrages the rebels

events.title: Koza Confronts the Fake King
events.description: Koza, leader of the rebel army, confronts the figure he believes to be King Cobra in the streets of Nanohana. Despite his father's advice to trust the king, hearing the confession about Dance Powder and witnessing the king's guards open fire on citizens destroys Koza's remaining faith in the monarchy.
events.significance: This moment represents the complete breakdown of trust between the rebels and the royal family. Koza's confrontation and subsequent wounding by royal guards serves as the final justification for the rebellion's march on Alubarna.

quotes.text: Father told me to trust the king... but after seeing this, hearing him confess with his own mouth...
quotes.speaker: Koza
quotes.context: Koza's internal struggle between his father's teachings and the apparent evidence before him

events.title: Koza is Shot by Guards
events.description: When Koza rushes forward to confront the fake king, guards open fire, shooting and wounding the rebel leader. This violent act against him, combined with the fake king's confession, convinces Koza that the monarchy has declared war on its own people.
events.significance: Koza being wounded by royal guards serves as the final catalyst for the rebellion. He interprets this violence as an official declaration of war from the king, removing any remaining hesitation about attacking Alubarna.

quotes.text: They shot me... The king has declared war on his own people!
quotes.speaker: Koza
quotes.context: Koza's realization after being wounded by guards

events.title: Mr. 1 and Miss Doublefinger Attack Nanohana
events.description: Baroque Works officer agents Mr. 1 (Daz Bonez) and Miss Doublefinger (Zala) crash a massive armory ship into Nanohana's harbor, causing destruction and chaos throughout the city. The attack is perfectly timed to coincide with the fake king's appearance.
events.significance: This coordinated attack serves dual purposes in Operation Utopia: it creates more chaos and destruction to blame on the 'king,' and it provides the rebel army with weapons needed for their assault on Alubarna.

events.title: Koza's Journey as Rebel Leader
events.description: As Koza confronts the fake king, he recalls his journey: remembering his father's advice to trust the king, the growth of the rebellion from nothing to 100,000 soldiers, the devastation of the drought across villages, and his evolution from hopeful citizen to militant rebel leader.
events.significance: This flashback provides context for Koza's internal conflict and shows how the drought and apparent royal indifference transformed peaceful citizens into rebels. It humanizes the rebellion and shows that Koza didn't want this war.

events.title: Young Boy Kappa Discovers the Deception
events.description: A young boy named Kappa witnesses Mr. 2 Bon Clay's true identity beneath the King Cobra disguise. Before he can alert others about the deception, Mr. 1 and Miss Doublefinger attack and severely wound him, silencing the only witness.
events.significance: This tragic moment shows how close the truth came to being revealed. The attack on an innocent child demonstrates the ruthlessness of Baroque Works and adds to the tragedy of the civil war built on deception.

events.title: Rebel Army Discovers Weapons Cache
events.description: The crashed armory ship that Mr. 1 and Miss Doublefinger brought to Nanohana is discovered to be full of weapons. A rebel soldier reports they don't have enough weapons for their 700,000 troops, but another exclaims the crashed ship is an entire armory, providing the arsenal they need. Koza proclaims this as 'divine guidance.'
events.significance: The perfectly-timed weapons cache, actually planted by Baroque Works, arms the rebel forces and enables them to launch their assault on Alubarna. What the rebels see as divine intervention is actually another manipulation by Crocodile.

quotes.text: This crashed ship is an armory ship! We finally have the weapons we need!
quotes.speaker: Rebel Soldier
quotes.context: Discovering the weapons aboard the crashed vessel

quotes.speaker: Koza
quotes.context: Koza's belief that fate has provided them with weapons for their cause

events.title: The Rebellion Begins Its March
events.description: With weapons in hand, wounds from royal guards, and the king's confession ringing in their ears, Koza orders the rebel army to march on Alubarna. The rebellion that has been building for years finally begins its assault on the capital, marking the start of the civil war.
events.significance: This is the point of no return for Arabasta. The rebellion's march on Alubarna represents the culmination of Crocodile's multi-year plan and sets the stage for the climactic battle. Everything Baroque Works has worked toward has led to this moment.

quotes.text: Rebel army! We march on Alubarna!
quotes.speaker: Koza
quotes.context: Koza's order to begin the assault on the capital

events.title: Crocodile's Cruel Taunt with the Cage Key
events.description: At Rain Dinners casino in Rainbase, Crocodile shows Vivi and the imprisoned Straw Hat crew the key to their cage. In a cruel display of power, he then throws the key into a pit filled with Bananawani (massive crocodile-like creatures), making escape seemingly impossible.
events.significance: This moment demonstrates Crocodile's sadistic nature and his absolute confidence in his victory. He gives his enemies hope by showing them the key, only to make escape appear impossible, forcing them to watch helplessly as Arabasta descends into war.

quotes.text: Here's the key to your cage. Unfortunately, it's now with the Bananawani.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile taunting the imprisoned Straw Hats and Vivi

events.title: Vivi's Determination Despite Imprisonment
events.description: Despite being imprisoned in a cage and having just witnessed Crocodile throw away the key, Vivi refuses to give up. She regains her spirit and attempts to escape even with her hands still tied, determined to prevent the impending war between the royal and rebel forces.
events.significance: This moment showcases Vivi's unwavering determination to save her kingdom. Even in the face of seemingly impossible odds, she refuses to surrender, embodying the theme of perseverance that defines the Straw Hat Pirates.

quotes.text: I won't give up! I have to stop this war!
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's determination to save Arabasta despite her imprisonment

quotes.text: This is Operation Utopia - the plan to take over Arabasta and acquire Pluton.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Explaining his master plan to Vivi

quotes.text: I confess - I have been using Dance Powder to steal the rain from you all! And now I must eliminate Nanohana to prevent this truth from reaching the Marines!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 2 Bon Clay (as King Cobra)

quotes.text: Rebel army! We march on Alubarna!
quotes.speaker: Koza
quotes.context: Ordering the rebellion to begin their assault

quotes.text: I won't give up! I have to stop this war!
quotes.speaker: Vivi

themes.description: The entire episode revolves around Crocodile's masterful manipulation of Arabasta through lies, impersonation, and staged events. The fake king's confession and the planted weapons demonstrate how Baroque Works has orchestrated every aspect of the civil war.
themes.symbolism: Mr. 2's shapeshifting ability represents the broader theme of deception - nothing is as it appears in Arabasta, and the truth has been hidden beneath layers of lies.

themes.theme: The Tragedy of War Built on Lies
themes.description: The episode emphasizes the tragic nature of the impending civil war - both sides believe they are fighting for justice, but the entire conflict is based on manufactured deception. Koza's internal struggle and the wounding of young Kappa highlight the human cost.
themes.symbolism: Koza's wound from the guards represents how the victims of manipulation suffer real consequences for fabricated crimes.

themes.description: Despite being imprisoned and seemingly helpless, Vivi refuses to give up on saving her kingdom. This mirrors the broader One Piece theme that willpower and determination can overcome any obstacle.
themes.symbolism: The cage key thrown to the Bananawani represents seemingly impossible challenges that the heroes will nevertheless overcome.

themes.description: Multiple characters and factions cross the point of no return in this episode - the rebels commit to war, Crocodile reveals his full plan, and the fate of Arabasta hangs in the balance.
themes.symbolism: The rebel army's march represents the irreversible momentum of events set in motion by years of manipulation.

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile's full plan is revealed, showing the depth of his scheming and his ruthless nature. His goal of obtaining Pluton establishes him as a threat beyond just Arabasta.
keyActions: Explains Operation Utopia to Vivi and the Straw Hats
Shows the cage key then throws it to the Bananawani
Orchestrates the rebellion's acceleration through his agents
quotes: This is Operation Utopia - the plan to take over Arabasta and acquire Pluton.
Here's the key to your cage. Unfortunately, it's now with the Bananawani.

characterSpotlights.development: Koza's character arc reaches a critical point as his last faith in the monarchy is shattered. His wounding and subsequent order to march shows his transformation from hopeful citizen to revolutionary leader, even though he's being manipulated.
keyActions: Discovers weapons cache on crashed ship
Orders rebel army to march on Alubarna
quotes: Father told me to trust the king... but after seeing this, hearing him confess with his own mouth...
Rebel army! We march on Alubarna!

characterSpotlights.development: Despite learning the full horror of Crocodile's plan and being imprisoned, Vivi demonstrates her unwavering determination to save her people. Her refusal to give up even in dire circumstances shows her growth from naive princess to determined leader.
keyActions: Listens in horror as Crocodile explains Operation Utopia
Attempts to escape despite being bound and caged
Maintains determination to stop the war
quotes: I won't give up! I have to stop this war!

characterSpotlights.development: Mr. 2 demonstrates the devastating effectiveness of his Clone-Clone Fruit by perfectly impersonating King Cobra, showing why he's a valuable member of Baroque Works. His performance as the fake king is the linchpin of Operation Utopia's final phase.
keyActions: Impersonates King Cobra using Mane Mane no Mi
Makes public confession about Dance Powder
Nearly discovered by Kappa before Mr. 1 silences the boy
quotes: I confess - I have been using Dance Powder to steal the rain from you all! And now I must eliminate Nanohana to prevent this truth from reaching the Marines!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime episode covers events from Chapters 171-172 of the manga with relatively faithful adaptation.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'GLORY -Kimi ga Iru Kara-' by Takako Uehara as the ending theme. The song would continue through episode 118.

sources.title: GLORY -Kimi ga Iru Kara- - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 107 aired on April 14, 2002 in Japan, during the height of the Arabasta Arc's popularity. The episode received an 8.1 rating on IMDb.

The ending animation for 'GLORY -Kimi ga Iru Kara-' features scenes of Vivi in the desert and montages of her journey with the Straw Hat Pirates, foreshadowing the emotional conclusion of the Arabasta Arc.
This episode marks a major turning point in the Arabasta Arc, as Operation Utopia transitions from planning to execution, setting up the climactic battle for the kingdom.
